abstract: India’s Bharti Enterprises of India plans to invest up to $2.5 billion to set up a nationwide chain of supermarkets and retail shops in partnership with  Wal-Mart, a top executive at the Indian company said. The investment will be spread over the next eight years and create jobs for about 60,000 people, Bharti’s joint managing director, Rajan B. Mittal, told reporters Monday. “The company has planned an investment of $2 billion to $2.5 billion by 2015,” Mr. Mittal said.
lead_paragraph: India’s Bharti Enterprises of India plans to invest up to $2.5 billion to set up a nationwide chain of supermarkets and retail shops in partnership with  Wal-Mart, a top executive at the Indian company said. The investment will be spread over the next eight years and create jobs for about 60,000 people, Bharti’s joint managing director, Rajan B. Mittal, told reporters Monday. “The company has planned an investment of $2 billion to $2.5 billion by 2015,” Mr. Mittal said.

headline.main: Bharti to Put Up $2.5 Billion in Venture With Wal-Mart
